title: Portland: Victoria's first settlement
brief_description: Traces the history of the development in the Portland region since the early nineteeth century when some two hundred sealers were working Bass Strait. Todays Portland’s deep harbour is used by ships from more than fifty countries as well as deep sea trawlers that land tonnes of fish. Portland’s latest primary industry looks to be an aluminium smelter being built at a cost of eleven hundred million dollars.
